channel.title: Need Help Getting Server Online!
channel.description: ok, so what i did, i portforwarded, i changed all the 127.0.0.1 in the server to ********.no-ip.org , i uploaded the client file onto uppit, i downloaded on main computer downstairs, i had it running on my laptop, had it logged on on my laptop, and tryed logging on downstairs, said "error connecting to server"... ANY IDEA?!?!?! please add my skype - ApexGamingCEO

item.title: Need Help Getting Server Online!
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“adamgulka, post:3, topic:519169”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=637628.msg4298074#msg4298074 date=1368554165]
You are on your network already so you are still 127.0.0.1 lol

Anybody outside of your house needs to be on the no-ip
[/quote]
So are you saying if i change the ip in MY client file to 127.0.0.1 and leave the other ones at no-ip THEY would be able to get on??? will that make a differnce in my client?? im not to good at java, but i dont think changing my client file would help them…[/quote]that’s correct. If you are hosting from your computer you stay on localhost and everybody else must connect via that ip

Read full topic

item.title: Need Help Getting Server Online!

So are you saying if i change the ip in MY client file to 127.0.0.1 and leave the other ones at no-ip THEY would be able to get on??? will that make a differnce in my client?? im not to good at java, but i dont think changing my client file would help them…
